intro: Gravesia masoalensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange. The plant is shrub-like, with small, leathery leaves and produces fragrant blooms during the dry season. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
